Migration guide for upgrading to MBC CQR: Migration guide for upgrading to MBC CQRS Serverless v1.1.0, including TENANT_COMMON breaking change and tenant code normalization.
This guide helps you upgrade from v1.0.x: This guide helps you upgrade from v1.0.x to v1.1.0. Version 1.1.0 includes breaking changes related to tenant code handling that require data migration.
All tenant codes normalized to lowercase: All tenant codes normalized to lowercase

Identify all tables using uppercase tena: Identify all tables using uppercase tenant codes in partition keys
Plan a maintenance window for the migrat: Plan a maintenance window for the migration
Test the migration in a non-production e: Test the migration in a non-production environment first

The `getUserContext()` function now norm: The `getUserContext()` function now normalizes tenant codes to lowercase:
If your existing data uses uppercase ten: If your existing data uses uppercase tenant codes in partition keys, queries will fail to find that data.
Migrate existing data to use lowercase t: Migrate existing data to use lowercase tenant codes

The Async suffix clarifies that these me: The naming was ambiguous. The `Async` suffix clarifies that these methods use DynamoDB Streams for asynchronous data synchronization.
This method was replaced by generateSequ: The method was replaced by `generateSequenceItem()` which provides a more consistent API and better return type.

Q: Can I skip the migration if I don't u: Q: Can I skip the migration if I don't use common tenant?
If you never use the common tenant featu: If you never use the common tenant feature (shared resources across all tenants), you may not need to migrate `TENANT_COMMON` data. However, you should still review tenant code normalization impact.

Q: Can I run the migration while the app: Q: Can I run the migration while the application is running?
We recommend performing migration during: We recommend performing migration during a maintenance window to avoid race conditions. If zero-downtime is required, use the gradual migration strategy with dual-read pattern.
